Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support because the expert mentions that a peer-reviewed study only covered the timeframe from 2010 to 2016, not from 2000 to 2016 as claimed by Casten.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the development of major drugs during the period mentioned, such as private funding or contributions from other government agencies.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times because it misrepresents the timeframe for which the claim is made, as pointed out by the expert.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim.
Exaggerate: There is no evidence of exaggeration in the claim.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that every major drug introduced from 2000 to 2016 came out of NIH funding, as the peer-reviewed study only covers the period from 2010 to 2016.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that NIH funding was the sole or primary source for the development of every major drug during the specified period, which may be a problematic assumption.
